website_summaries.verdict: With its sleek design and big 1080p touch screen, the 15.6-inch Asus Chromebook C523 is a unusual bargain: a budget-friendly big-screen Chromebook.
pros: Bargain-basement price for a large-screen Chromebook
cons: Glossy screen coat is a glare magnet

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is fantastic. Charged to 100%, and it lasted 2 and a half days. You get what you pay for. It's a little slow with processing documents through Google Docs, but it's fine. Also runs Android apps, which is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Lee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment from the word go.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for the wife. When we booted it up the Chromebook instantly came up with an error with OS. Called tech support straight away...very helpful but sadly I was the 10% where a USB rescovery didn’t work. Very disappointed and will certainly not purchase a chromebook again from first impressions. Have since returned for full refund as out of stock. I have since purchased another laptop for the same value with Windows 10 and is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Superish Medic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant little chromebook. I have had it on constantly from full charge for an hour now and it's at 91%. I have went from windows to this and would never look back. After having it for 2 days its brilliant and easy to learn your way around it. Good things to know are there is no right click. So to do this you have to hold alt then click with your mouse pad. There is also no caps lock but to do this press the magnifying glass button and alt at the same time then shift to turn it off again. This has been a godsend already for me getting my college work done
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb value for money
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son to take to take to 6th form as its cheap and lightweight. I've just spent a week in Greece using it on clients cloud based accounts work and found it excellent. Can't believe I can now basically run my business on a £130 laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: A great little chromebook
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my old laptop with a new one, and I dont like windows much, so a friend suggested I try the Google chromebook and I am very happy with it. It does not use windows os, it uses googles own os. It was very easy to set up and easy to use. You can download apps from google play store just like a phone. As soon as i log in , googles internet search engine opens up straight away. The battery life is very good. Plus I am using it to write this review. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ormsby

customer_reviews.title: Dead as a Do-Do
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed! Plugged in...it produced setup...did...no problem as we are IT folk with years of experience..it immediately forced us into updates even though did not give us time to set timeout period. Switched off itself three times then dead...would not boot up. We have bought Asus device before..few years back..same problem. Our WiFi is A1...we have not time to sort out new items that are faulty. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Bunty

customer_reviews.title: Low price, high spec, poor screen.
customer_reviews.text: A bargain touchscreen Chromebook, but a dreadful screen lets it down. The keyboard is great, the build seems sturdy and it looks good. However, if you're close to the screen, it's impossible to position it so that the whole thing is equally lit. Nothing seems clear, and the field of view (both top to bottom and left to right) is incredibly narrow. It is a bargain, but if you can, go a little more expensive and buy something a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Nedward

customer_reviews.title: Choose a good spec. And it will do most people.
customer_reviews.text: Love this chrome book. If Internet and streaming movies plus using Google apps on a bigger scale is what you want this will serve you well. Turn on. Sign up or sign in too your Google account. Bang. Your good too go. It updates automatically and as fast as a smartphone. If you need a laptop for music software and things like that stay with or keep your Microsoft laptop. This chrome book is thin and light. 4 gig and 64 will do most people.
customer_reviews.author: mr nicholas a pearce

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want a touchscreen and browser, and not much more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to act as a console for a digital live music mixer. I just needed something portable with a good sized touch screen and a browser and wifi to connect with the mixer. It's great, very light and compact and clear screen. I haven't tested the battery life to the full but it seems to be able to run for a couple of hours which is ideal for controlling the sound in a gig without a nearby power socket. Mine is a bit of an obscure application but I would be very happy to use this as a working laptop if I was just working online, which these days I tend to do.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rust

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable ChromeBook for price but mine had imperfections!
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat disappointed with this ChromeBook, I already own a flip ChromeBook which is very thin and lightweight but this is quite heavy and bulky. I had to return as the top of the lid had a few blebs in the top right hand corner making the surface uneven, where it should be flat and smooth. How it got past quality control is beyond me. However, Amazon were great about it and as soon as they received the ChromeBook back I was refunded - minus £1.99 for returning, when I was told it would be free to return as it was imperfect. Not very amused but at least the return went OK.
customer_reviews.author: Aiden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for school work and browsing the net
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant little laptop. Fast, battery life is perfect. Easy to set up and connect to google account. Bought for my daughter for school and i can easy monitor what she does via my phone. Bonus is it lays flat too. So no rolling over and crushing the screen like she did the old one. Has apps for chrome, mail, YouTube and playstore to make it easier to access things
customer_reviews.author: pix-e

customer_reviews.title: Great at what it does
customer_reviews.text: Not tried a chrome book before but this is perfect for what i need, basically a portable laptop for work, basic notes, sheets and slides (word, excel and PowerPoint equivalents) as well as getting online and managing apps. It's lightweight, has a great battery life and works well enough offline if you're not connected but works best with a strong internet connection. A great second laptop for home, school or office.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Coxon

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: This is awful. Mine appears to have real issues doing anything. I bought my daughter the same and it was fine. I can't have more then two tabs open on very basic web sites. It crashes constantly takes ages to turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Missy-Hannon

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Only reason this does not get 5 stars is the usability of the mouse function is not as responsive as a normal laptop but with some tweaking you can get it to be more intuitive. Also the book does not use 'right click' but uses the term in instructions which was confusing but with some research I discovered that two finger tap does the same but you have to know or do research to find these things out. The screen is a good size but not so great with glare but this is minor as you just move out of the light or adjust more, I'm being picky its great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: A Debenham

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt get it to start
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't know how this item is. I couldnt get further than the white chromebook screen and that was a two day feat...the screen immediately went dark again. After two days I gave up and am returning it. I needed it for my kids homework it really shouldnt be so hard but while looking online it seems a common issue. Maybe if your technologically knowledgeable it's a different story . But I will be spending more money on something easier to use. One star only because I couldnt give it anything lower.
customer_reviews.author: mtltp

customer_reviews.title: Does not like being used when it is being charged.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my previous Acer Chromebook which had a cracked screen. I was initially happy with this product as it seemed very similar to my old one. However, there is one difference which I am not happy about. The battery seems to need charging quite frequently, which would not be a problem in itself, but I find as soon as I plug it in to charge up, within a couple of minutes it becomes impossible to use as the icon freezes. It is tempting to leave the thing on charge permanently but I know this is not good for it. Would therefore not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Light

customer_reviews.title: What a super little device
customer_reviews.text: The weight is the eye catcher, I can lift it with one hand. Whereas other similar ones are a good 200 grams heavier. If I have to be picky, then it's the fact that some apps from the Google Play Store were not compatible. That, however is a tiny inconvenience, when set against the way this nifty little Chromebook performs. Delivery, by Amazon Local Collect, was excellent. Full marks all round
customer_reviews.author: Charlie54

customer_reviews.title: Poor screen
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed.... this screen was one of the worst I have ever seen. Its made of plastic and screen contrast was horrible I couldn’t see colours clearly here. You can’t adjust colours either al you can do is put in night mood and volume brightness but neither of them helps. If you lower any of them screen is hardly visible. Design is beautiful I love Asus design but quality it’s very bad and quality matters more than design in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Monika gaki

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: Call me silly but this was quite hard for me to use. I never knew it would be so hard to turn your caps lock on. Every time I did, I would mistakenly hit the search bar. It's really frustrating. There is no right click options for quick spell checks. I have to copy wrong words into google for auto correct. It is not compatible with local mouse. I know you are trying to be different but no need to change computer language people have been used to for years. I cannot be bothered to load any pics.
customer_reviews.author: LALA

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR CHROME USERS, LOOKING FOR BUDGET LAPTOP
customer_reviews.text: We where looking for a light budget laptop for work and school. tested many for around the 200-300 mark this was by far the best choice. PRO's Perfect for chrome/google user By far the best from all budget laptops we tested. Much like my phone OS, quick to install no messing about with windows stuff No excess power going to windows junk we will never use. perfect size for light computing, light, under a kg effeicient quick enough feels great good brand CON's no touchscreen could be quicker, though is quick enough for work and price backet
customer_reviews.author: Lynck 82

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Its not a tablet its more like a laptop. It does everything I would do on a laptop - email, streaming video, looking at photos and general office type documents. If you want to do everything you can do on a smartphone but with a proper keyboard and reasonable size screen (with a USB type c to HDMI cable you can use a TV like a monitor) then this is well worth considering. Its light, fast and without the frustrations of MICROSOFT or restrictions of APPLE.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Small and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product, exactly as described. Quick delivery. Only problem is I should have bought larger screen item, purely because my eyesight is not as good as it used to be. Perfect for younger person.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. V. A. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic value, just don't expect anything beyond basic internet function
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic value. The overall size/form/feel, battery life, screen quality, audio quality, and interface/OS are all stunning for the money (paid roughly £160 a while ago). Just don't expect it to do anything beyond basic internet use e.g. social media, YouTube and single-person video calling. It locks up if you try to do video conferencing e.g. Zoom/Hangouts, totally freezes/crashes and requires hard reset. As above the functionality is otherwise superb.
customer_reviews.author: UK customer

customer_reviews.title: A neat device
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely neat and portable device which succeeds at doing everything it is supposed to. Its limitations as a Chrome OS device are, to an extent, compensated for by easy access to the Google Play store, which provides Android versions of popular Windows software such as Word and Excel. The on-board memory is adequate and storage can be increased by adding a micro SD card. The non-touch screen is large enough, without being as large as a full-size laptop, and the keyboard is very usable. Battery life is excellent. All in all this machine offers a lot of functionality for a very low price.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Watson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sluggish right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Edit: returned this because it was SO slow. I already loathe this thing. Even though I've only just started using it, it's already really laggy doing basic things like opening and closing the Chrome browser and navigating my Google Drive folders. The build quality feels super cheap, the mouse pad is atrocious. Overall it's just really under-powered; clearly it needs more RAM and a faster processor. But at least it's really small and light.....
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on advice that it could handle basic tasks like email, web browsing, opening documents and basic word processing and simple spreadsheets. It also has a video camera so I expected it to handle video calls at basic quality. It cannot handle even the very basic tasks eg opening a single, simple spreadsheet, without freezing after 5-10 minutes use. The notebook is basically unusable for about 15 minutes until it calms down again, then the cycle starts again. Truly awful.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I knew already before buying that the quality of the screen will be bad and that battery is below the average what you can expect from the Chrome OS devices. Still, an excellent product for the discounted price I paid. Pentium N4200 is more than enough for web and youtube. Don't expect to be able to play any games. Chrome OS experience is a pleasant surprise. Battery time is still much better comparing to an average WIndows laptop. Quality of sound was another pleasant surprise. Camera is awful though. Amazing build quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aigars Gedroics

customer_reviews.title: Generally good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop about 5 months ago. It's generally great but over the past few weeks it's been turning off while I've been using it. It's doing it more recently and sometimes won't turn back on for quite a while. Given that it isn't that old this is a bit disappointing. Screen is nice and wide though and I like the chromebook side of things.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Collins

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Complete false economy. The system is so slow it can’t even handle a Zoom meeting without glitching and crashing. Supposed to be touch screen and it’s not. Other reviews say it’s a perfect first laptop but I would have to disagree. Absolute rubbish. Will be returning this as it’s 100% not fit for purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Asus chromebook o.s.
customer_reviews.text: Was going to send this back as it is NOT AS STATED.It is 13.5 not 15.6 inch screen. However when open and used the screen is good enough for me and the laptop is extremely fast. Set's up in seconds. It may not have Microsoft but I always use Google Chrome anyway. Recommended. Glad I kept it. Great price too. ( only 4 stars is cos screen is the wrong size. Have told the seller but they still have not changes it )
customer_reviews.author: joanna koomen

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for my netbook. I wanted something light and portable for web designing. Battery life is fantastac. I have no problems tearhering a hot spot with my mobile phone. Great if you want something to do internet based work on. It does have playstore built in to download apps. I have successfully managed to watch movies and tv shows online with no interuptions to the stream. The internal storage is not massive but you do have the options of mounting a memory card for extra storage. Great little product for me once i got used to having no caps lock key and using the shift and search keys to achieve this.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Rochford

customer_reviews.title: Comes with hardware issues
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this laptop, everything seemed fine, but it has a lot of issues. While working something on it, it cannot be charged at the same time. While listening to music, the system kind of crashes, and produces very weird noises. So I thought at first that probably is just my laptop and I returned it. Then I ordered another one and has the same issues. I would not recommend it. I know that one cannot expect much for this price, but at least it should come functional.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: The computer keeps restarting every few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Initially the screen kept freezing with just 3 windows open, but now it is restarting every few minutes . Assume I was sent I faulty item, but I've also seen a lot of other bad reviews for this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Nice little laptop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for my teenage son which he's very pleased with. It's lightweight & compact making it easily stored away and fits nicely into a school bag without excess weight. We've yet to see how the battery performs as it's brand new. Has enough USB ports and a memory card slot for extra storage space making it perfect for backing up documents.
customer_reviews.author: Risha

customer_reviews.title: Light and faster and better than Microsoft Windows
customer_reviews.text: I like this computer. Better and faster than Windows. Nice if you are happy with google and working with their apps. Disadvantages I have found so far are that it will not play a DVD on an external drive. Chrome is designed for online stuff mainly. My encryption program on memory stick is not compatible with Chrome so have to use non-encrypted part of the stick. But there is always GoogleDrive. I am pleased I got this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Macmillan

customer_reviews.title: files don’t load
customer_reviews.text: so disappointed. problems from the start. files don’t load. how am i supposed to use a laptop when i cant view any of my files? don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sending back
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for remote working, started having issues when using remote Citrix session and assumed maybe it was Citrix, screen flickers intermittently, black them comes back, sometimes just randomly as you typed . Other times it went black , comes back right away but whatever key you had been typing carries on across the screen. Removed Citrix and still black screens intermittently so it's clearly faulty... Guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Simon James Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality and light
customer_reviews.text: Changed from Windows to now chromebook. I was fed up with constant windows updates and felt time for a change. The quality of the asus is exceptional it feels solid,sturdy and well made. Battery life is great, about 9 hours. Laptop has a nice low profile and is light. Things are in different places so may take a bit of getting used to this. I am impressed for what I need it for
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Rubery

customer_reviews.title: great chromebook for students and adults!
customer_reviews.text: I got this chromebook for one of my sons - he needed a chromebook for school but i didn't want to buy the one the school were offering. The chromebook is so small and light and the battery life is great. So far so good. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: GregThurtle

customer_reviews.title: Works okay if you don't mind frequent crashes, I suppose.
customer_reviews.text: I would not necessarily endorse this product. I use it only for college assignments, mostly on Google docs. It freezes and crashes very easily. Sometimes for no apparent reason, such as whilst highlighting a paragraph on a Google docs. The cursor will become unresponsive and the screen will eventually just go black and you'll have to re open your tabs. Battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: alex guzelian

customer_reviews.title: fast start up
customer_reviews.text: bought this chrome book because i,m well fed up with windows updates, 1903 would not go on my lap top i swore if i had any more problems with windows i would buy a chromebook and now i wish i,d bought one years ago it is brilliant, fast start up very responsive and i dont have to worry about updates anymore its great for surfing the web and emails if you dont do a lot of work on a laptop and just want basic this is for you im sure there is a lot more to this laptop than i need but eh this is brilliant ASUS well done
customer_reviews.author: picanto man

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: My first chromebook - disappointing, the RAM isn't nearly enough to support many tabs. I literally thought I had received a faulty model with fewer RAM erroneously installed, but it does indeed have 4 GB. Even if it's sometimes hard to believe. Having to resort to manual memory management (closing unused tabs and apps on the regular) otherwise performance will suffer. Good battery but unusable while charging. The charger bricked itself after 10 months. I still like the chromebook concept but this particular model, I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano Artesi

customer_reviews.title: Low quality item
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality, Plastic and very bright beyond disappointed. Would be suitable for young child to learn to type but in all honesty not much more than that
customer_reviews.author: amazondom

customer_reviews.title: I adore this laptop
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to write notes on in university and use as a highly transportable notebook, and this is absolutely perfect for that. It's the perfect size for typing on (I hate too small keyboards !) and it's incredibly durable and light. I've accidentally dropped this a few times (onto carpet mind!) & sat on it and it hasn't even got a dent. (not intentionally for either of these, I'm just fairly clumsy!)
customer_reviews.author: PJ Jones

customer_reviews.title: It just doesn’t neat my needs especially printing
customer_reviews.text: It’s not a touch screen. It’s always giving me an OS error message when I try to do what I consider to be normal searches or connections. I can’t print from my email. It’s just difficult and I have no instructions. I have hardly used it and wish I could return it. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DON'T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! This laptop crashes frequently and often when loaded up the touch pad mouse doesn't work and I have to either use a mouse or restart the computer multiple times before the touch pad begins to work. It's often slow and freezes regularly. Don't buy this product!!
customer_reviews.author: mrs h

customer_reviews.title: versatile little laptop
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a little lightweight laptop that I'd be able to use on the train, but I was worried that ChromeOS wouldn't give me the tools and apps I want available offline (or on poor train wifi). However the latest versions give you access to a linux environment in which you can install IDEs, compilers, design tools, source control, whatever you need. So this chromebook turns out to be a very handy tool while travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Murray Read

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely doesnt do what i expected. Unable to install kali linux, unable to install emulators, unable to do anything really that my 6 year old phone cant do. Display is bigger that is all.
customer_reviews.author: Silent_Priest

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Product has already broken. You cannot open more than 4/5 tabs as it will just freeze. The screen needs to be constantly shut and opened for it to unfreeze. Awful laptop, would not suggest buying
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Struggled with simple tasks (emails, sheets etc)
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just to read emails, do finances, read/watch the news. Nothing too stressful and all on Chrome native apps - Chrome, sheets, YouTube - and yet it routinely crashes. I can't really think of a simpler use case than mine and it still failed. It's a shame because the design is fine it's smart, lightweight and compact and the battery life is very good must be said. All I wanted was something cheap and lightweight to do the simplest of tasks on. Get what you pay for I suppose; my advice to those looking for similar is spend just another £100 or so, I doubt you'd regret it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good little laptop - but you need to buy Office for it and you cannot straighten photos on it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a light and neat laptop. However, I bought it to take on holiday and download photos and edit them. For some reason it has failed to include a 'straightening' tab. It seems mean - it would hardly have taken any more effort, so I am disappointed there.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A. M. Owen-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: im typing on this right now and it is really good, so good that my husband has ordered one as well. This is an amazing little cromebook. I added my google account so have my music on it and a movie downloaded, some apps all fine. Streams off Prime really well sound is good too. Very happy so far.....
customer_reviews.author: Wyeam

customer_reviews.title: Really good laptop for kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this laptop much better than their old tablet they had only down side is the 32 gb is nothing for storage especially when you can download any app from the google however i will check out if there is a way to buy more storage
customer_reviews.author: khan

customer_reviews.title: Got on a Prime day deal- so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I got this laptop during prime day, I've had it little more than 24 hours but it's already impressed me. It's a good value spec for the price and is great for day to day web based computing. It's very lightweight and looks very sleek compared to some on the market. Happy so far but will see how it fares in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for those less tech savvy in the family
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my non-tech savvy dad. He wanted a basic laptop to browse the internet, YouTube and a couple of basic apps (Facebook, etc). In that, you can't go wrong with a Chromebook. All the functionality of a laptop, but the simplicity of a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: pjdavies2000

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for the job
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and stylish, works perfectly. Exactly what I required. Happy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve George

customer_reviews.title: Quick and reliable little machine.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine, needed something to check emails, bit of online browsing etc. Perfect, boots quickly, battery life great, very impressed. I have a Windows laptop, hardly use it now because it wants to update every time it's not used for a few days!! For basic everyday use this little chromebook is fab.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: Good. Quiet, no fan computing With Anker Premium 5-in-1 USB-C Hub, 4K USB C to HDMI Adapter, SD/TF Card Reader, with 2 USB 3.0 Ports, for MacBook Pro 2019/2018/2017, iPad Pro 2019/2018 at £17 - really good. With Linux capability - Excellent Recommend large capacity SDXC cards
customer_reviews.author: oooo

customer_reviews.title: Screen quality makes this unusable
customer_reviews.text: No amount of adjusting screen position, size of display or brightness makes text clear. Headache after half an hour of using.
customer_reviews.author: Campfire Mag UK

customer_reviews.title: Asus C223 For the price, it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because my £700 Chromebook ( a Lenovo Yoga C630) developed a fault, and Lenovo has taken over two weeks, and it's still not been repaired. I needed a device. I wasn't expecting much. I've been very pleasantly surprised by the Asus and would most definitely recommend it. The screen is a little bit dull and low resolution compared to more expensive models, but it'd perfectly adequate for general computing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very slow and cheap feel
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this is very slow. The whole keyboard also has a cheap feel to it. I brought an ACER 4 years ago for £200 in Currys, and it is still faster than this one, and I've used that practically every day. So, in summary, this is slower and feels less quality than a cheaper, much older Chromebook. I wouldn't recommend this model at all. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: M Watson

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed not easy to use, cant download my Kindle and the sale 8included a special deal on McAfee security which has been impossible to download but has been charged for.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerJoyce Dalton

customer_reviews.title: A great little chromebook for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons college work and he loves it,a great looking little chromebook which caters for his needs.work on the go and web browsing or just watching films or YouTube, this is great
customer_reviews.author: stephen allan

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't switch on
customer_reviews.text: Laptop would not even switch on. Very poor. Was offered a replacement by Amazon but given this was my first impression of the product I'm not willing to see how long it will last in months or years to come after I do get past the stage of being able to turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: lja1

customer_reviews.title: It freezes up when charging on n off.
customer_reviews.text: If I had read the previous reviews about the laptop freezing up whilst charging I would not have purchased this item. Otherwise it seems like a good laptop. It did not come with any information sheets to do with the spec etc.
customer_reviews.author: gaynor riley

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: the touch screen still not work this out shame as that is the feature that I ordered it for my old one was both a pad and a laptop much better but time will tell
customer_reviews.author: tris

customer_reviews.title: not the best 3 months and we are sending it back
customer_reviews.text: Broken within 3 months slow to respond physically the keys don't work daughter's got school work as has everyone but can't get to do it amazon will not take it back as it is over a month old
customer_reviews.author: J. horton

customer_reviews.title: Absolute rubbish!
customer_reviews.text: I only purchased this model because They no longer support the old, wonderful version.
